definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Today before you think of saying an unkind word, Think of someone who can't speak.
sentences.chinese: 如今，在你出言不遜前，想想那些身患啞疾的人吧。

sentences.english: It was rude of a student to sass to the master.
sentences.chinese: 學生對校長出言不遜是粗魯無禮的。

sentences.english: Big sister listen to nine younger sister linesmen, quickly condemned.
sentences.chinese: 大妹聽“九妹”出言不遜，急忙譴責。

sentences.english: You are always abusing and offending people.
sentences.chinese: 你總是出言不遜得罪人。

sentences.english: She burned with fury at his unkind remarks.
sentences.chinese: 她對他的出言不遜怒火中燒。

sentences.english: For the first time, psychologists have found that swearing may serve an important function in relieving pain.
sentences.chinese: 這是心理學家們頭一次發現出言不遜具有鎮痛的功效。

sentences.english: What he said about Tom’s mother was way below the belt.
sentences.chinese: 他對湯姆的媽媽評論的話真的是出言不遜。

definition: to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
